div.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which hibernate entities are generated. Please NOTE that the entity implementation classes will also be generated to this location when no operations are present on the entity with instance scope.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which hibernate entity implementation files are generated. Please NOTE that the entity implementation classes will be generated to the entities outlet when no operations are present on the entity with instance scope.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which hibernate entity mapping files are generated, these are the ones with the .hbm.xml extension.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The location to which hibernate enumeration user-types are generated. This includes String CLOB, BLOB and enumeration user-types.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which Session EJB service wrappers are generated. If this property is not specified, Session EJB service wrappers will not be generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which Session Bean implementation files are generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which the hibernate.cfg.xml file is generated.

a.title: Go to Outlets namespace element group

td.documentation: The directory to which the ehcache.xml file is generated.

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: Enable/disable hibernate's second level cache features for the cartridge.

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation:
If this property is set to true, distributed caching will be enabled. To enable distributed caching for an entity, you must set this property to true AND tag the entity using the tagged value @andromda.hibernate.entity.cache.distributed tagged value.
true
false

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: The multicast port to be used for multicast group communication when using a distributed cache provider (see hibernateEnableDistributedCache).

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: The address to be used for multicast group communication when using a distributed cache provider (see hibernateEnableDistributedCache).

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: The number of seconds client sockets will wait when sending messages to this listener until they give up.

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the default strategy for Entities caching. Can be overwritten using the corresponding tagged value. Possible values are:
read-write
nonstrict-read-write
read-only

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the default strategy for associations between Entities caching. Can be overwrited with the corresponding tagged value. Possible values are:
read-write
nonstrict-read-write
read-only

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default query cache usage. Can be overwritten using @andromda.hibernate.query.useCache. Possible values are:
true
false

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: Enable/disable Hibernate's second level cache feature for entity associations. Please NOTE that hibernateEnableCache should also be enabled when specifying this property.

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the path to the directory where cache files will be created

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines Hibernate Cache Provider implementation class. Possible values for Hibernate2 are:
net.sf.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.HashtableCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.JCSCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.SwarmCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.TreeCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.OSCacheProvider
Possible values for Hibernate3 are:
org.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.HashtableCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.JCSCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.SwarmCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.TreeCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.OSCacheProvider

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines Hibernate Query Cache Factory implementation class. Possible value for Hibernate2 is:
net.sf.hibernate.cache.StandardQueryCacheFactory
Possible value for Hibernate3 is:
org.hibernate.cache.StandardQueryCacheFactory

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation:
Specify when Hibernate should release JDBC connections. By default, a JDBC connection is held until the session is explicitly closed or disconnected. For an application server JTA datasource, you should use after_statement to aggressively release connections after every JDBC call. For a non-JTA connection, it often makes sense to release the connection at the end of each transaction, by using after_transaction. auto will choose after_statement for the JTA and CMT transaction strategies and after_transaction for the JDBC transaction strategy.
Valid values are:
on_close - default
after_transaction
after_statement
auto

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the default maximum number of objects that will be created in memory.

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines a default value for the eternal parameter.

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the default time to idle for an element before it expires.

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the default time to live for an element before it expires.

a.title: Go to Caching namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the default value for the overflow to disk property.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: JDBC Driver to make database connection, this should be a fully qualified Java class name.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: The database user login name.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: The database user password.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: URL for the JDBC Driver to make the connection to the database.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: JNDI name of data source to use. (would be used instead of the connection properties, driver, username, password, etc).

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to log SQL statements.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: SQL dialect of the database.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Sets a maximum "depth" for the outer join fetch tree. Recommended values between 0 and 3

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: A non-zero value determines the JDBC fetch size

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: A nonzero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. Recommended values between 5 and 30

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to enable use of JDBC2 scrollable resultsets by Hibernate. This property is only necessary when using user supplied connections. Hibernate uses connection metadata otherwise.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to use streams when writing / reading binary or serializable types to/from JDBC.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation:
Automatically export schema DDL to the database when the SessionFactory is created. With create-drop, the database schema will be dropped when the SessionFactory is closed explicitely. Permitted values are:
update
create
create-drop
validate (since Hibernate 3)

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Allows you to define new Hibernate query tokens. For example: giving this a value of true=1, false=0 would cause the tokens true and false to be translated to integer literals in the generated SQL.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: The suffix to use for identifier sequences.

a.title: Go to JDBC namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not to use outer join.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Entity all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Entity".

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the entity implementation name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an embedded value implementation name.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing hibernate enumerations.

a.title: Go to Name Patterns namespace element group

td.documentation: The prefix to give to the Session EJB JNDI names (this allows the same Session EJB to be deployed multiple times in the same container)

a.title: Go to Transactions namespace element group

td.documentation:
The default value to use for service operations transaction types.
Permitted values are:
NotSupported
Supports
Required
RequiresNew
Mandatory
Never
NOTE: Can be overridden on a per entity basis with the @andromda.ejb.transaction.type tagged value.

a.title: Go to Transactions namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the hibernate transaction factory class to use.

a.title: Go to Transactions namespace element group

td.documentation: Strategy for obtaining the JTA TransactionManager.

a.title: Go to Transactions namespace element group

td.documentation: The JNDI name of the JTA UserTransaction object.

a.title: Go to Transactions namespace element group

td.documentation: The fully qualified class name of the Hibernate TransactionFactory implementation.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
The version of Hibernate to use when generating. Allowable values are:
2 - Hibernate 2.x
3 - Hibernate 3.x

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Set to true to enable Hibernate's XML persistence support using dom4J. The hibernateVersion namespace property must be set to 3.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Set to true if the identifier for generated entities should be mapped to an attribute of the entity's XML tag, or as a separate field when XML persistence support is enabled. The hibernateXMLPersistence namespace property must be set to true for this option to have meaning.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The default class to use for Hibernate ID generation (can be overridden on a per entity basis with the @andromda.hibernate.generator.class tagged value).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The value of the default-cascade attribute of the hibernate entity XML mapping.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
Indicates how a UML composition should be interpreted as cascade.
If undefined, the cascade attribute is computed by AndroMDA in the following manner: if default-cascade is save-update or all, then cascade is all (0..1) or all-delete-orphan (many) otherwise cascade is delete.
If the property IS defined, it's value is generated at each occurence of a UML composition, and the inverse side is marked with cascade="none". The value must be a valid Hibernate cascade style. You should use a cascade value which includes delete to be conform with the UML concept of a composition, e.g. all-delete-orphan.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
Indicates how a UML aggregation should be interpreted as cascade. Possible values are are as follows:
If undefined, aggregation is not interpreted as a cascade value
If the property IS defined, its value is generated at each occurence of a UML aggregation, and the inverse side is marked with cascade="none". The value must be a valid Hibernate cascade style, e.g. all.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the default value dynamic-insert property on entities.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the default value dynamic-update property on entities.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines if proxies will be enabled for Hibernate Entities.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Whether or not named parameters (i.e. ':someParameter') or unnamed (i.e. '?') parameters should be used in the HQL queries embedded within the model. NOTE: Does not apply to queries written in OCL.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the hibernate inheritance strategy (unless overridden on an entity level by the @andromda.hibernate.inheritance tagged value, can be the following possible values:
class - table per hierarchy.
subclass - table per class in hierarchy.
concrete - Table per class.
union-subclass - Table per class (Only Hibernate 3).
interface - Root class is defined as an interface and the attributes remapped to the subclasses. This is useful in the concrete case because it has limitations in the associations.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
Denotes whether or not subclasses should be mapped into the same .hbm.xml file or in a separate one.
Set this value to subclass when you want to have a mapping file per entity
The default is hierarchy which will render a mapping file per subclass

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The default name of the discriminator-column on the hibernate entity XML mapping.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The default type of the discriminator-column of the hibernate entity XML mapping.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Allows you to turn on/off whether or not composite associations will define eager loading.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: If EJBs are being used, this specifies the default view type for the EJB interfaces. Can be either local or remote.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Used to define the default mapping for hibernate collections.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Used to define how elements will be sorted within the collection defined by the association. (Only available for maps and sets).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines if the finder setters method for parameters will use "setParameter" for all parameters (by default), or a specialized setter (setDate, setBoolean, etc.) in case the parameter type has it's own setter method.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the property/attribute to automatically add to entities for versioning purposes. If this value is not specified or it contains only whitespace characters it will be ignored and the property will not be generated. This value can be overridden with the @andromda.hibernate.versiontagged value.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
Defines the default outer join value for many to one and one to one association ends. Possible values are:
auto
true
false
For hibernate 3 the above values will be translated to
join
select

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as lists.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as sets.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as maps.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as bags.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: A flag indicating whether or not specific collection interfaces will be used in association end mutators and accessors (i.e. java.util.Set, java.util.List, etc). If this is set to false, then the value of the defaultCollectionInterface property will used to provide the collection interface.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The default collection interface, this is the interface used with association end accessors and mutators if the specificCollectionInterfaces flag is set to false.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The default association end collection index name (this can be overridden by the @andromda.hibernate.collection.index).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group
Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: URI specifying the specific mappings from model types to hibernate types. (i.e. file:${basedir}/HibernateTypeMappings.xml). This is not necessary but useful for defining hibernate user types (when hibernate doesn't support a specific type in the manner needed for your application).

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name of the security realm (i.e. animal-quiz, other, etc). NOTE:This enables EJB security if specified.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group
Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Defines the package for the Hibernate user types

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: The name to give to the generated service locator class.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Hibernate connection pool size.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: JNDI name bound to the SessionFactory.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Encoding for generated XML files.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation: Indicates whether or not a default equals and hashCode implementation should be generated.

a.title: Go to Other namespace element group

td.documentation:
Hibernate3 comes with a brand-new, ANTLR-based HQL/SQL query translator. However, it is still buggy and so in mean time use the Hibernate 2.1 query parser which is still available. Possible values are:
org.hibernate.hql.ast.ASTQueryTranslatorFactory (for the new query parser)
org.hibernate.hql.classic.ClassicQueryTranslatorFactory (for the old parser)
